channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-1023] Check global flusher
item.description:
It doesn't seem to be responsive:

2008-11-22 16:48:53,135 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.MemcacheFlusher: Flushing streamitems,(�,1227400186823 because over global limit of 536870912
2008-11-22 16:48:53,135 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion: Started memcache flush for region streamitems,(�,1227400186823. Current region memcache size 52.8m

Why all the flushes? Why is global size same though we've dumped some flushes?

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: THis is probably a non-issue – we keep flushing until we hit low water mark. Might not be that smart? At least add in the debug message above (was hacked into the streamy src). Otherwise, this stuff operates in silence.

Global flusher should not have hardcoded values but rather should be percentages of configured heap. Also, current low-water mark seems austere at half the the high-water mark; could be a higher (Keep flushing till usage at 512 goes to 256M). Would suggest that as part of this patch, replace the high and low MB with high and low percentages of heap.
Resolving by adding log of global flush checker events. Let HBASE-1027 be about changing global checker so it operates on percentages of heap rather than on hardcoded MB sizes.
